meanings.definition: To remove from a mold or container.
meanings.sent1: She was unmoulding the freshly baked cake from the pan.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully unmoulded the gelatin dessert onto a plate.
meanings.sent3: After many failed attempts, she finally succeeded in unmoulding the jello.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job was like unmoulding himself from a rigid mold.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's hands expertly unmoulded the clay into a beautiful vase.

meanings.definition: The act of taking something out of a mold or container.
meanings.sent1: The unmoulding of the chocolate bar revealed a perfect shape.
meanings.sent2: Careful unmoulding is essential to maintain the integrity of the final product.
meanings.sent3: The unmoulding of the ice cube tray was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: Her graduation marked the unmoulding of her future from years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The unmoulding of the new sculpture left the artist feeling accomplished.
